trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException"></xref> class exception is thrown when a requested object is not found in the underlying directory store.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException"></xref> class with a specified error message.
A message that describes the error.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException"></xref> class, using the specified serialization information and streaming context.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object for the exception.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> for the exception.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException"></xref> class with a specified error message and an underlying exception object.
A message that describes the error.
An <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> object that contains underlying exception information.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException"></xref> class with a specified error message and information about the requested object.
A message that describes the error.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> object that describes the type of the requested object.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the name of the requested object.
Sets the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with information about the exception.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that holds serialized object data about the exception that is being thrown.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Gets the name of the requested object.
A string that contains the name of the requested object.
Gets the type of the requested object.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> object that represents the type of the requested object.
